commit_message:
Tests: Randomize tests

We've had broken unit tests for a long time, and we don't realize
because they are always being executed in the same order, and when they
start failing it's harder to understand WHY it is happening.

This patch forces all our unit tests runs to execute tests in a
randomized order to ensure we find bad tests faster.

Change-Id: I1d3107652b6bb9c9f83a54e307165aaa41f100fb

commit_message:
Update python testing as per zed cycle teting runtime

In Zed cycle, we have dropped the python 3.6/3.7[1] testing
and its support. Removing the py36 centos8 job as well as
updating the python classifier also to reflect the same.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/zed.html

Change-Id: Ic3d741f4ad7445fd1b43cc08877c296bc71cc278

is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for antelope. Also,
updating the template name to generic one.

commit_message:
Update python testing as per zed cycle teting runtime

In Zed cycle, we have dropped the python 3.6/3.7[1] testing
and its support. Removing the py36 centos8 job as well as
updating the python classifier also to reflect the same.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/zed.html

Change-Id: I2654adc4e4c5b26cfeca6e9c331be9b705705504

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/zed branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I026675add799d2a2f77fc7b117a467aee90c2090
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/zed

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/zed branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I026675add799d2a2f77fc7b117a467aee90c2090

subject: Tests: Fix linstor tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-29 15:06:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/17f1d21ee2ec83f07cafee1a0aa466a80b6968b9', 'message': 'Tests: Fix linstor tests

Some LinStor tests break depending on the order they are executed,
because they modify the VOLUME_STATS_RESP global variable.

This patch fixes this by using deepcopy of that VOLUME_STATS_RESP and
also fixes some tests that were not actually expecting the right data

Change-Id: I3aa1a5bda2e7702b2a79dcfd9eb4159ab9d22600

commit_message:
Tests: Fix linstor tests

Some LinStor tests break depending on the order they are executed,
because they modify the VOLUME_STATS_RESP global variable.

This patch fixes this by using deepcopy of that VOLUME_STATS_RESP and
also fixes some tests that were not actually expecting the right data
(they expected data set by a different test).

Order that shows one such failures:

- LinstorIscsiDriverTestCase.test_iscsi_get_volume_stats
- LinstorBaseDriverTestCase.test_get_volume_stats

Change-Id: I3aa1a5bda2e7702b2a79dcfd9eb4159ab9d22600

commit_message:
[RBAC] Retain legacy admin behaviour

The cross project effort around establishing
secure default RBAC policies has transformed over
the last release reacting to operator feedback.
The intended change to use system scope breaks
established workflows and requires a large effort
to transition deployments:

- https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/BER-2022-OPS-SRBAC
- https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/rbac-operator-feedback

So for now, all services are going to revert to
only supporting project scoped users by default.
This allows a legacy admin behavior to continue
working as intended; and does not prevent operators
overriding these defaults and using system scoped
personas.

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/consistent-and-secure-rbac.html

Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I5d3c1041738214ec8382edfd5494c10ff0be351a
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Update docs for Hitachi driver

Update the setup about storage devices for the driver.

Change-Id: Id69a7b59d09fe377e22b8b971225275484eae3b5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/34/809534/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Common resources: - ``All resources`` All storage resources, such as DP pools and host groups, can not have a name including blank space in order for the driver to use them. - ``User accounts`` Create a storage device account belonging to the Administrator User Group. - ``DP Pool`` Create a DP pool that is used by the driver. - ``Resource group`` If using a new resource group for exclusive use by an OpenStack system, create a new resource group, and assign the necessary resources, such as LDEVs, port, and host group (iSCSI target) to the created resource. - ``Ports`` Enable Port Security for the ports used by the driver. If you use iSCSI: - ``Ports`` Assign an IP address and a TCP port number to the port.
deleted_lines: #. User accounts Create a storage device account belonging to the Administrator User Group. #. DP Pool Create a DP pool that is used by the driver. #. Ports Enable Port Security for the ports used by the driver.

commit_message:
Tests: Fix versions view

The test_build_versions test from the API views version tests
accidentally modifies the file's FAKE_VERSIONS global constant, which
may make other tests fail when run afferwards (eg: test_build_links).

This patch fixes this issue using a deepcopy to ensure that the global
constant is not modified.

Change-Id: I7b7ffa233cd838836fd1423de9442c6adb974dbb

commit_message:
Update min supported service version for Zed

Nova only supports compute services that are not older than version
N-1. So in Zed the smallest supported nova compute version is Yoga
and the smallest Yoga service version is 61.

Change-Id: I4cbe233087577c7754856afcc4e3fe9fdc2d3008
Signed-off-by: Takashi Natsume <takanattie@gmail.com>

subject: [NetApp] Fix lack of retry HTTP requests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-05-04 08:19:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/4b9ca52cd47610650bd9d65027237157aa2ecfe4', 'message': '[netapp] retry requests

according to https://urllib3.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/urllib3.util.html#module-urllib3.util.retry

to fix
"Temporary failure in name resolution"

commit_message:
[NetApp] Fix lack of retry HTTP requests

The driver HTTP requester is not handling connection error with some
retries for avoiding temporary network failure in name resolution.
This patch adds a custom `HTTPAdapter` with 5 retries, according to
urrlib3 documentation [1]. Also, the connection retry will be visible
in the log [2].

[1] https://urllib3.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/urllib3.util.html#module-urllib3.util.retry
[2] https://paste.opendev.org/show/bIcwjk91d4vy5Hnxxs4Z/

Closes-Bug: #1971542
Change-Id: Ic9ff8208f10df9dbed09717d6b218f6293d2338a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/31/840431/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from requests.adapters import HTTPAdapterfrom requests.packages.urllib3.util.retry import Retry max_retries = Retry(total=5, connect=5, read=2, backoff_factor=1) adapter = HTTPAdapter(max_retries=max_retries) self._session.mount('%s://' % self._protocol, adapter)

commit_message:
Tests: Fix PowerMax tests

The PowerMax unit tests are currently a nightmare, and it's a miracle
that they pass at all at the gate, as there are hundreds of execution
ordering variations where they will fail.

There are many tests that can fail, but the mostly do 2 things wrong:

- Modify PowerMax own testing global constants

- Forcefully replacing methods with Mocks and not restoring them
  afterwards.

In some cases they modify non PowerMax libraries, so we may see failures
in completely unrelated tests.

Change-Id: I05d7e857c52c98aad12b4aeb8958d3e65fbce774

commit_message:
Run featureset062 job with tempest-allow

This patch replace the tempest_test_whitelist with tempest_allowed_group
that is to be used by tempest-allow.

Depends-On:- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-tempest-skiplist/+/851395
Testing here:- https://code.engineering.redhat.com/gerrit/c/testproject/+/397264

Change-Id: I84584f6e9428974e7e1f2b492e3333d86a8f6f7f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/63/851963/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # With fs62 group we are running two sets one for train release and # one for other releases tempest_allowed_group_check: "featureset062" # In Integration and periodic line, we run only smoke tests, hence the special # group is defined here fs62_periodic tempest_allowed_group_periodic: "featureset062_periodic" {{ tempest_allowed_group_check }} {{ tempest_allowed_group_periodic }}tempest_allowed_group: >- {% if ('periodic' in zuul.pipeline and not job.force_non_periodic|default(false)|bool) or (job.force_periodic|default(false)|bool) or (job.component is defined|default(false)|bool) -%} {{ tempest_allowed_group_check }}
deleted_lines: # Tests for train release # octavia-tempest-plugin is pinned to a particular hash, not all # tests can be runned there, so we are trimming it tempest_test_train: - 'octavia_tempest_plugin.tests.scenario.v2.test_healthmonitor' - 'octavia_tempest_plugin.tests.scenario.v2.test_l7policy' - 'octavia_tempest_plugin.tests.scenario.v2.test_load_balancer' - 'octavia_tempest_plugin.tests.scenario.v2.test_pool' - 'octavia_tempest_plugin.tests.scenario.v2.test_listener' - 'octavia_tempest_plugin.tests.scenario.v2.test_l7rule' - 'octavia_tempest_plugin.tests.scenario.v2.test_member' # In Integration line, we run only smoke tests tempest_test_integration: - 'octavia_tempest_plugin.tests.scenario.v2.test_traffic_ops.TrafficOperationsScenarioTest.test_basic_http_traffic' - 'octavia_tempest_plugin.tests.scenario.v2.test_pool' {{ tempest_test_train }} {{ tempest_test_integration }}# As the whole test suite take time, so we are trimming the testlist tempest_test_check: - 'octavia_tempest_plugin.tests.scenario.v2.test_healthmonitor' - 'octavia_tempest_plugin.tests.scenario.v2.test_listener' - 'octavia_tempest_plugin.tests.scenario.v2.test_member' - 'octavia_tempest_plugin.tests.scenario.v2.test_load_balancer' tempest_test_whitelist: >- {% if ('periodic' in zuul.pipeline and not job.force_non_periodic|default(false)|bool) or (job.force_periodic|default(false)|bool) -%} {%- elif 'train' not in release -%} {{ tempest_test_check }} {{ tempest_test_train }}

commit_message:
Tests: Fix cmd tests

There are 2 tests in TestCinderManageCmd that break other tests that
come after them because the are forcefully replacing cinder_manage.CONF
and not restoring it after the test has run.

This patch modifies these 2 tests to mock it instead:

- test_main_remove_cluster
- test_main_missing_action

Change-Id: I75ac03884d5ac6f81491b6d0d049521971d08745

commit_message:
Add CI job for podified VF

Add CI for podified in order to test the build and the run, to make
sure nothing breaks.

Change-Id: Ide984601c01e8f2a1f1c522ea547be0a770f9a79
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/validations-libs refs/changes/47/855647/37 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- - hosts: tempest name: validations-libs-podified roles: - ensure-tox - ensure-pip - ensure-virtualenv - ensure-podman - role: ensure-if-python vars: zuul_work_dir: "src/opendev.org/openstack/validations-libs" tasks: - name: Build Validation container shell: cmd: "src/opendev.org/openstack/validations-libs/container/validation --build " executable: /bin/bash - name: Run Validation container shell: cmd: "src/opendev.org/openstack/validations-libs/container/validation -R --cmd run --validation check-ftype " executable: /bin/bash

commit_message:
Switch to 2023.1 Python3 unit tests and generic template name

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for antelope. Also,
updating the template name to generic one.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: I4e0579f1085f3a79bbd3e76784396408e5968d59
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/10/857910/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Tests: Fix NFS tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-23 20:10:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/5c4138d3a3f360ea5f4b46a116e121864b87cd83', 'message': "Tests: Fix NFS tests

There are 2 NFS unit tests that won't run successfully on their own and
depend on other tests from the same file to be run previously to work as
intended:

- test_create_sparsed_volume
- test_create_nonsparsed_volume

The issue is caused by calling the self.override_config method when we
are actually using a Mock in the driver for the configuration.

This patch replaces the calls with simple assignments and adds a comment
explaining why this is the right way to do it.

We only make these changes in the NfsDriverTestCase class and not the
NfsDriverDoSetupTestCase class because the latter uses a real class and
can use the override mechanism.

Change-Id: I9325a677376beb44a8c39d9c07d0b48e02a8844f
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2022-08-24 08:41:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/eef26ba18eae0ddae0d6dee3bf1a63250da5a2ab', 'message': "Tests: Fix NFS tests

The NFS and Remotefs unit tests use a mocking of the cinder
Configuration object as the driver configuration.

This makes the usage of self.override_config not work as expected, and a
couple of tests actually use it, so it will only work if the test run
has run a test that forcefully sets the value.

If we have these tests:

  def test1(self):
      self.configuration.option = True
      ...

  def test2(self):
      self.set_override('option', False)
      ...

It will fail if test2 runs before test1.

There are currently 2 tests that use the override_config in the nfs UT
file and where its success depend on the test runnin order:

- test_create_sparsed_volume
- test_create_nonsparsed_volume

This patch removes the mocking and uses a proper Configuration so that
the whole file can use the standard override_config method.

Change-Id: I9325a677376beb44a8c39d9c07d0b48e02a8844f
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2022-08-29 15:06:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/d3cbad37d06990c3a078e8027421cdcf42200d39', 'message': "Tests: Fix NFS tests

The NFS and Remotefs unit tests use a mocking of the cinder
Configuration object as the driver configuration.

This makes the usage of self.override_config not work as expected, and a
couple of tests actually use it, so it will only work if the test run
has run a test that forcefully sets the value.

If we have these tests:

  def test1(self):
      self.configuration.option = True
      ...

  def test2(self):
      self.set_override('option', False)
      ...

It will fail if test2 runs before test1.

There are currently 2 tests that use the override_config in the nfs UT
file and where its success depend on the test runnin order:

- test_create_sparsed_volume
- test_create_nonsparsed_volume

This patch removes the mocking and uses a proper Configuration so that
the whole file can use the standard override_config method.

Change-Id: I9325a677376beb44a8c39d9c07d0b48e02a8844f
"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2022-08-29 15:10:16.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/test_nfs.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/685e35c9b8e0cee93ebeb9ba938bbd9ee865144e', 'message': "Tests: Fix NFS tests

The NFS and Remotefs unit tests use a mocking of the cinder
Configuration object as the driver configuration.

This makes the usage of self.override_config not work as expected, and a
couple of tests actually use it, so it will only work if the test run
has run a test that forcefully sets the value.

If we have these tests:

  def test1(self):
      self.configuration.option = True
      ...

  def test2(self):
      self.set_override('option', False)
      ...

It will fail if test2 runs before test1.

There are currently 2 tests that use the override_config in the nfs UT

commit_message:
Tests: Fix NFS tests

The NFS and Remotefs unit tests use a mocking of the cinder
Configuration object as the driver configuration.

This makes the usage of self.override_config not work as expected, and a
couple of tests actually use it, so it will only work if the test run
has run a test that forcefully sets the value.

If we have these tests:

  def test1(self):
      self.configuration.option = True
      ...

  def test2(self):
      self.set_override('option', False)
      ...

It will fail if test2 runs before test1.

There are currently 2 tests that use the override_config in the nfs UT
file and where its success depend on the test runnin order:

- test_create_sparsed_volume
- test_create_nonsparsed_volume

This patch removes the mocking and uses a proper Configuration so that
the whole file can use the standard override_config method.

Change-Id: I9325a677376beb44a8c39d9c07d0b48e02a8844f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/69/854269/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove lower-constraint job from stable/yoga

This patch removes the lower-constraint job from the stable/yoga branch.

This is part of a series of patches that will remove the job from all stable
branches of Designate.

The lower constraint check is important on the master branch to make sure that
new patches are tested against the lowest supported version of dependencies.
This helps packagers make sure they have at least the minimum version of a
dependency packaged along with the service.
After a release and the stable branch is created, these jobs can cause
problems maintaining the stable branches as bug fix patches are released for
the dependency projects.
For this reason, we are proposing to maintain the lower-constraints job on the
master branch, but disable it on the stable branches.

Change-Id: I5998a723d7f664a6c487eccc6e93541084f4d376

commit_message:
Change to use iproute2 instead of brctl

brctl is being deprecated in some Linux distros, so
change container driver to start using iproute2 commands.

Closes-bug: #1877410
Change-Id: If679e79fa3242ee1cd8610b5525deca35b41c87e

commit_message:
Constraining runtime selection and behavior to improve local testing stability

New issues were encountered during unit test execution on local machines,
caused by introduction of new runtime and unexpected mock behavior.

Patch limits the test execution enviornmnet to Python3.8, while removing
offending autospecced mocks from unit tests.

Closes-Bug: #1982750

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I67e7e594cb1aa4f6043c1ca1869828efc7f119b5

commit_message:
Remove wrong equal sign

According to the official doc[1], the syntax was wrong, leading to
issues. It wasn't detected until now, because the option wasn't
actually used.

[1] https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/builder/#arg

Note: It is not a clean cherry-pick as file names got changed
in stable/trian.

Change-Id: Icdbc8d687e1a19ec4015c57acc05d35ddcfd2a77
(cherry picked from commit e9a1797366a97af171aa421180939e20bf018d4d)
(cherry picked from commit cc5500282ad645722df71b03ae890703b75c80c5)

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/zed

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/zed branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I96613315ab67188b1a929f1ab0dac33e54e7ebf5

commit_message:
Update master for stable/zed

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/zed.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/zed.

Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Mark panko projects as retired

panko was deprecated in Xena cycle already, this patch marks
* panko
* python-pankoclient
* puppet-panko
as retired and move their entries to legacy.yaml.

Change-Id: I0bec371f442c4e39557bf1f0d94697e1577bb838

commit_message:
Charmhub migration for stable/train (bionic-only)

This is the main patch for the migration of the stable/21.10
charm to charmhub for the stable/train branch (train track on
charmhub).  This patch initially supports bionic from queens
to train, and does not support ussuri.  It supports upgrades
from bionic-queens to bionic-train (with each intermediate
step needed).  Crucially it does NOT set a default
openstack-origin, which means installing train/stable
without specifying the openstack-origin will result in a
bionic-queens installation.  This is intentional as the branch
covers queens to train.

Change-Id: I8a87d9dbe223aa6fbc61ec5931289da6b92063b7

commit_message:
Switch to 2023.1 Python3 unit tests and generic template name

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for antelope. Also,
updating the template name to generic one.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/zed

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/zed branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I6dcb41cc294b7dea8057add7963dd09f4b3fe21e

commit_message:
Add operating_status to loadbalancer related models

In OVN-Octavia-Driver repo, the health monitor feature is assuming
the presence of 'operating_status' attribute on loadbalancer and
pool model returned from DriverLibrary.get_loadbalancer and
DriverLibrary.get_pool, which are not available in curent
implementation.

Story: #2009760
Task: #44231
Change-Id: I387e121c119d0df09ed26890e3fc6ae2c758f9f4
